description: 7-email sequence for prospects who haven't engaged with Triangle Intelligence

subject.version_b: Quick question about {{companyName}}'s China import costs

subject.version_a: {{firstName}}, AutoParts Mexico SA case study (full details)
subject.version_b: How one {{industry}} company saved $685K in 90 days

content.plainText:
{{firstName}},

Since you're in {{industry}}, I thought you'd appreciate the complete AutoParts Mexico SA transformation story.

üìä THE CHALLENGE (January 2024):
‚Ä¢ Company: AutoParts Mexico SA
‚Ä¢ Industry: Automotive components (similar to your space)
‚Ä¢ China imports: $2.8M annually
‚Ä¢ Trump tariffs: $685K additional costs
‚Ä¢ Cash flow impact: Severe
‚Ä¢ Timeline pressure: Immediate solution needed

üöÄ THE SOLUTION (Triangle Intelligence + Mexico Partners):

WEEK 1-2: Supplier identification and vetting
‚Ä¢ Identified 5 potential Tijuana partners
‚Ä¢ Conducted on-site quality audits
‚Ä¢ Negotiated USMCA-compliant supply terms
‚Ä¢ Selected 3 primary suppliers

WEEK 3-4: Compliance and documentation
‚Ä¢ HS code classifications optimized
‚Ä¢ Certificate of Origin processes established
‚Ä¢ CBP pre-clearance applications submitted
‚Ä¢ Regional content calculations verified (68% qualified)

WEEK 5-8: Pilot implementation
‚Ä¢ Started with 20% of import volume
‚Ä¢ Monitored quality and delivery performance
‚Ä¢ Refined logistics and documentation workflows
‚Ä¢ Scaled to 100% Mexico routing

üìà THE RESULTS (90 days later):
‚Ä¢ Annual tariff savings: $685,000 (100% elimination)
‚Ä¢ Quality improvements: 15% defect reduction
‚Ä¢ Lead time improvements: 6-8 weeks ‚Üí 2-3 weeks
‚Ä¢ Compliance efficiency: 73% less paperwork
‚Ä¢ Cash flow improvement: $57K monthly
‚Ä¢ ROI on Triangle Intelligence: 2,847%

üí¨ CEO QUOTE:
"We were skeptical about Mexico routing, but the Trump tariffs forced us to act. Triangle Intelligence made what seemed impossible feel routine. The $685K savings paid for itself in the first month."
- Carlos Martinez, CEO AutoParts Mexico SA

ü§î COULD {{companyName}} REPLICATE THIS?

Based on your industry and estimated import volume, I believe similar results are achievable.

Your potential savings estimate: ${{estimatedSavings}}
Implementation timeline: {{timelineEstimate}} days
Compliance complexity: {{complexityLevel}}

Interested in exploring how this applies to {{companyName}}?

{{caseStudyCallLink}}

Alex Rivera
Business Development

P.S. - Carlos Martinez (AutoParts CEO) has agreed to speak with other automotive executives considering Mexico routing. Would that be valuable?

subject.version_a: {{firstName}}, the Mexico supplier rush is real

emails.preheader: Market intelligence: supplier capacity filling fast

content.plainText:
{{firstName}},

I need to share some concerning market intelligence about Mexico supplier availability.

üìä RECENT DATA (Last 30 days):
‚Ä¢ Mexico partnership inquiries: +340% vs last year
‚Ä¢ Average supplier response time: 3-4 weeks (was 1-2 days)
‚Ä¢ New partnership slots available: Down 67%
‚Ä¢ Wait lists at top suppliers: 40-60 companies
‚Ä¢ Implementation timelines: Extended 4-6 weeks

üö® WHAT'S DRIVING THE RUSH?
1. Trump's tariff escalation threats
2. China supply chain uncertainty
3. USMCA treaty advantages becoming widely known
4. Success stories like AutoParts Mexico SA going viral

üí° THE PATTERN WE'RE SEEING:

Companies are moving in 3 waves:

üåä WAVE 1 (Jan-Mar 2024): Early adopters
‚Ä¢ Got premium supplier partnerships
‚Ä¢ Shortest implementation timelines
‚Ä¢ Best pricing and terms
‚Ä¢ Multiple backup supplier options

üåä WAVE 2 (Apr-Aug 2024): Fast followers  
‚Ä¢ Decent supplier partnerships available
‚Ä¢ Standard implementation timelines
‚Ä¢ Market-rate pricing
‚Ä¢ Limited supplier choice

üåä WAVE 3 (Sep-Dec 2024): Reactive companies
‚Ä¢ Struggle to find quality suppliers
‚Ä¢ Extended implementation timelines  
‚Ä¢ Premium pricing due to demand
‚Ä¢ Often settle for suboptimal partnerships

‚ùì WHERE DOES {{companyName}} FIT?

Right now, you're between Wave 2 and Wave 3.

Good news: Quality partnerships still available
Bad news: Window is closing rapidly

Based on your {{industry}} focus, I can still secure:
‚úì 2-3 vetted supplier options

‚úì Priority consideration status

‚è∞ TIMELINE REALITY:
Q1 2025 suppliers will be overwhelmed

Want to secure your Mexico supplier assessment while options remain strong?

{{supplierAssessmentLink}}

Alex Rivera
Business Development

--- CONFIDENTIAL MARKET INTEL ---

Recommended Action: Immediate assessment

subject.version_a: {{firstName}}, what if USMCA doesn't work for {{companyName}}?
subject.version_b: Addressing honest concerns about Mexico routing

emails.preheader: Let's discuss realistic limitations and alternatives

content.plainText:
{{firstName}},

I've been reaching out about Mexico USMCA routing for {{companyName}}, but you haven't responded.

That's often a sign of valid concerns or skepticism.

Let me address the most common hesitations honestly:

‚ùì "IS MEXICO ROUTING ACTUALLY LEGAL?"
‚úÖ Absolutely. USMCA (formerly NAFTA) provides the legal framework.
‚úÖ 500+ companies successfully implemented.
‚úÖ CBP pre-approved documentation processes.
‚ùå However: Requires proper compliance and documentation.
‚ùå Not suitable for all product categories.

‚ùì "WHAT ABOUT MEXICO'S QUALITY AND RELIABILITY?"
‚úÖ Top-tier Tijuana suppliers match/exceed China quality.
‚úÖ Shorter supply chains mean better oversight.
‚úÖ Many suppliers are Chinese-owned facilities relocated to Mexico.
‚ùå However: Due diligence is critical for supplier selection.
‚ùå Not all Mexico suppliers meet North American standards.

‚ùì "ARE THE SAVINGS CALCULATIONS REALISTIC?"
‚úÖ Based on actual CBP tariff schedules.
‚úÖ AutoParts Mexico SA: $685K verified by PWC audit.
‚úÖ Conservative estimates typically exceeded by 10-15%.
‚ùå However: Implementation costs must be factored in.
‚ùå Savings depend on product mix and qualification levels.

‚ùì "WHAT IF OUR PRODUCTS DON'T QUALIFY FOR USMCA?"
‚úÖ Most manufactured goods qualify with proper sourcing.
‚úÖ Regional content rules are flexible (62.5% threshold).
‚úÖ Alternative strategies exist for non-qualifying products.
‚ùå However: Some products genuinely don't qualify.
‚ùå Complex supply chains may need restructuring.

üéØ HONEST ASSESSMENT FOR {{companyName}}:

Based on your {{industry}} focus and estimated import profile:
‚Ä¢ USMCA qualification likelihood: {{qualificationEstimate}}%
‚Ä¢ Implementation complexity: {{complexityLevel}}
‚Ä¢ Potential annual savings: ${{savingsRange}}
‚Ä¢ Recommended timeline: {{timelineRecommendation}}

‚öñÔ∏è MY RECOMMENDATION:

Invest 30 minutes in a qualification assessment.

If Mexico routing isn't viable for {{companyName}}, I'll be the first to tell you and suggest alternatives.

If it IS viable, you'll have concrete data to make an informed decision.

No cost, no obligation, just honest analysis.

{{qualificationAssessmentLink}}

Alex Rivera
Business Development

P.S. - 23% of companies we assess aren't good fits for Mexico routing. That's perfectly fine - wasting time on unsuitable strategies helps nobody.

subject.version_b: Last check: Is {{companyName}} interested in tariff alternatives?

emails.preheader: Final outreach, then moving to quarterly updates

content.plainText:
{{firstName}},

This is my final email about immediate Mexico USMCA opportunities for {{companyName}}.

I've shared:
‚úì AutoParts Mexico SA case study ($685K savings)
‚úì Specific Tijuana supplier recommendations
‚úì Market intelligence about capacity constraints
‚úì Honest assessment of potential limitations
‚úì Free qualification assessment offer

You haven't responded, which tells me either:
a) Now isn't the right time for {{companyName}}
b) Mexico routing isn't a priority
c) My emails aren't reaching you
d) You're evaluating alternatives

All perfectly valid reasons.

ü§ù HERE'S WHAT HAPPENS NEXT:

I'm moving {{companyName}} to our quarterly update list:
‚Ä¢ Mexico market developments
‚Ä¢ New supplier partnerships
‚Ä¢ Regulatory changes affecting {{industry}}
‚Ä¢ Success stories from similar companies
‚Ä¢ No sales pressure, just market intelligence

üìß SIMPLE CHOICE:

Reply with:
‚Ä¢ "QUARTERLY UPDATES" - Market intelligence only
‚Ä¢ "REMOVE COMPLETELY" - No further contact
‚Ä¢ "TIMING CHANGED" - Ready to explore opportunities
‚Ä¢ "DIFFERENT CONTACT" - Wrong person, redirect to [name/email]

üîÆ LOOKING AHEAD:

Trump tariff situations will likely intensify.
Mexico supplier capacity will continue tightening.
USMCA advantages will become more valuable.

Your opportunity won't disappear, but it may become more expensive and time-consuming to implement.

Whatever you decide, I appreciate your time and consideration.

Alex Rivera
Business Development
Triangle Intelligence

--- FINAL OUTREACH NOTICE ---
Sequence: Completed
Next Contact: Quarterly (if requested)
Assessment Offer: Remains open

emails.delay: 30 days after email 1 (only if no response to email 6)

subject.version_a: {{firstName}}, one quick question before I close your file
subject.version_b: Quick favor: What prevented {{companyName}} from exploring Mexico routing?

emails.preheader: 2-minute feedback helps us serve other companies better

content.plainText:
{{firstName}},

Before I officially close {{companyName}}'s file, I have one quick question:

What prevented you from exploring Mexico USMCA routing?

I'm asking because:
a) It helps us improve our approach
b) We better understand market needs
c) Your insights benefit other {{industry}} companies

üìã COMMON RESPONSES (no judgment):
‚Ä¢ "Too busy with other priorities"
‚Ä¢ "Mexico routing seems too complex"
‚Ä¢ "Already have China supply chain locked in"
‚Ä¢ "Waiting to see how tariffs develop"
‚Ä¢ "Working with other consultants"
‚Ä¢ "Budget constraints this year"
‚Ä¢ "Your emails never reached the right person"
‚Ä¢ "Skeptical about the savings projections"

üéÅ APPRECIATION GIFT:
Regardless of your reason, I'll send you:
‚Ä¢ Q4 Mexico Market Intelligence Report
‚Ä¢ USMCA Qualification Self-Assessment Tool  
‚Ä¢ Directory of 50+ Vetted Mexico Suppliers
‚Ä¢ No strings attached

‚è±Ô∏è 30 SECONDS:
Just reply with your reason, and I'll send the resources.

Your feedback helps us serve the next {{industry}} company better.

Thanks for considering,

Alex Rivera
Business Development
Triangle Intelligence

P.S. - 89% of companies who provide this feedback eventually explore Mexico routing within 12 months. Market conditions change, and so do priorities.
